basics.name: Gabryel Mason-Williams
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: PhD Student in the Theory of Deep Learning | Google 2023 Academic Scholar | Research Software Engineer at the Rosalind Franklin Institute

work.name: Rosalind Franklin Institute
work.summary: Research Software Engineer, working promdinetly one day a week across a range projects.
highlights: Creator and sole developer of DisTRaX, which is a Python application for deploying temporary storage systems onto High-Performance Compute (HPC) infrastructure in a fast and scalable fashion. For our Cryo-EM software, it reduced processing times and I/O overhead by 4.37% and 100%, respectively.
Involed in a successful grant bid for £10,000 in research funding for ”Using Novel Cluster Technology to Improve Performance of Cryo-EM Analysis” with the University of Bristol
Played an active role in the creation and teaching of the lessons in machine learning for the first-year PhD students.

work.name: Exeter Mathematics School
work.summary: Maths Circle Mentor is predominantly online, however occasionally in person.
highlights: Mentored students in years 8 and 9 in mathematics to encourage the development of mathematical thinking outside of the school context.
Successfully improved their ability to be adventurous, articulate and accepting by providing them with challenging questions and creating an effective collaborative learning environment

work.name: Diamond Light Source
work.position: Scientific Computing Research Placement: Year in Industry Student
work.summary: Researched: High-Performance Object Stores for Intermediate Data processing
highlights: Created GRAM a kernel module to represent RAM as a block device for Ceph and DisTRaC an application that allows Ceph to run on a High-Performance Computing cluster using RAM, which led to a reduction in I/O and processing times of 81.04% and 8.32%, respectively.
Presented a poster at Ceph Day CERN and gave a talk/demo of DisTRaC to the Ceph Science Group.
Created a proof of concept for the visualisation of objects inside an object store in real-time, which was presented at the SuperComputing 19 conference in Denver, STFC booth.
Awarded a 3-month contract extension due to excellent work.

Awards and Comedable Achievements.title: 4th Place at CIUK Cluster Challenge
Awards and Comedable Achievements.summary: Lead a team of 5 HPC novices to 4th in the CIUK Cluster Challenge.

Awards and Comedable Achievements.title: Google Europe Students with Disabilities Academic Scholarship
Awards and Comedable Achievements.summary: One of ten students in europe to achive the award that recognises (i) demonstration of passion to computer science; (ii) academic merit; and (iii) demonstration of leadership skills.

Awards and Comedable Achievements.title: Principle Scholarship
Awards and Comedable Achievements.summary: University award that covers PhD tuition fees, and provides annual tax-free stipend for 3 years

Awards and Comedable Achievements.title: Master's Project Published at ICLR 2024
Awards and Comedable Achievements.summary: Self proposed Master's project was published at a world class venue in AI.

Awards and Comedable Achievements.title: Bachelor’s Research Project in Collaboration With the Rosalind Franklin Institute
Awards and Comedable Achievements.summary: Of my volition, I sought and established a research project in collaboration with the Rosalind Franklin Institute.

Awards and Comedable Achievements.title: Dean's List
Awards and Comedable Achievements.summary: Awarded to students who achieved above 70% in a academic year.

volunteer.organization: Reading Group for the Fundamentals of AI
volunteer.summary: Manage and organise the reading group by inviting speakers and finding papers to explore.
